Package ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers

Class PushController

java.lang.Object
ajbc.doodle.calendar.controllers.PushController
@RestController public class PushController extends Object
Restful api service that enables users to subscribe to the calendar push notification service, and receive their notifications to their browser.
Author:
Anna Aba

  • Method Details

    • publicSigningKey

      @GetMapping(path="/publicSigningKey", produces="application/octet-stream") public byte[] publicSigningKey()
      Get request that returns the public key of the server.
      Returns:
      array of bytes which represents the public key.

    • publicSigningKeyBase64

      @GetMapping(path="/publicSigningKeyBase64") public String publicSigningKeyBase64()
      Get request that returns the Base64 public key of the server.
      Returns:
      the public key as a Base64-encoded string.

    • subscribe

      @PostMapping("/subscribe/{email}") public boolean subscribe(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.webpush.Subscription subscription, @PathVariable(required=false) String email)
      Subscribe user and his browser to the push notification service.
      Parameters:
      subscription - object that holds the user's subscription data.
      email - the email of the user.
      Returns:
      true if logged in successfully.

    • unsubscribe

      @PostMapping("/unsubscribe/{email}") public void unsubscribe(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.webpush.SubscriptionEndpoint subscription, @PathVariable(required=false) String email)
      Unsubscribe user and his browser from the push notification service.
      Parameters:
      subscription - object that holds the user's subscription data.
      email - the email of the user.

    • isSubscribed

      @PostMapping("/isSubscribed") public boolean isSubscribed(@RequestBody ajbc.doodle.calendar.entities.webpush.SubscriptionEndpoint subscription)
      Returns true if browser is subscribed to the push notification service.
      Parameters:
      subscription - object that holds the user's subscription data.
      Returns:
      true if the browser is already subscribed.
